name: Seated Cable Mid Trap Shrug
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on a seated cable row machine with the cables positioned at chest height.
2. Hold the handles of the cable columns with your hands shoulder-width apart and your elbows slightly bent.
3. Engage your core to maintain proper posture and lift your feet off the floor, keeping them flat and balanced on top of the footrests.
4. Slowly pull the cables towards your midsection by contracting your trapezius muscles, shoulders down.
5. Focus on squeezing your scapulae together at the peak of contraction.
6. Pause briefly in this position to hold the contraction.
7. Release the tension and slowly return to the starting position.
short_summary: The seated cable mid trap shrug is a back exercise that isolates the trapezius muscles, targeting the upper part of the back.
